newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia Krka says H1 net up 14 pct.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia Krka says H1 net up 14 pct.

text.p: Slovenian pharmaceutical firm Krka said on Thursday its net profit in the first half of the year jumped 14 percent to 1.9 billion tolars ($11.3 million).
Spokeswoman Janja Pozar told Reuters the firm expected full-year net profit to reach 3.6 bilion tolars, up from 3.1 billion tolars in 1996.
She forecast full-year sales would rise six to seven percent from $310 million last year.
In the first half of 1997 were up by three percent to $153.1 million, of which $114 million came from exports.
The largest increases were registered in the former Soviet Union, where sales rose 15 percent, and in Poland, where sales were up by 12 percent.
Krka shares, which are listed on the over-the-counter section of the Ljubljana bourse, rose 0.12 percent to 25,030 tolars. -- Marja Novak, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
